head.title: West Orange-Cove Consolidated Independent School District

meta.content: West Orange-Cove Consolidated Independent School District

span.div: West Orange-Cove Consolidated Independent School District
Empowering Lives Through Excellence Every Day

li.a: West Orange-Stark Early College High School

header.h2: WOCCISD Remains Closed for Remainder of 2019/2020 School Year

div.p:
Dear Mustangs,
We are providing you with an update on school closures related to the COVID19 Coronavirus. Our schools will remain closed through the end of the school year per a directive from Texas Governor Greg Abbott.
Rest assured that during the school closures, we will continue providing services, including online learning opportunities and meals to our families. Thank you all for your patience and understanding during this difficult time. The Flexible Education Program and Grab-and-Go meals will continue until June 3.
We are still maintaining our original graduation date as is, but that is subject to change based on further direction from the Texas Education Agency.
For more resources, visit WOCCISD-at-Home pages on our website as well as help desk emails for each campus. www.WOCCISD.net.
Free “Grab and Go” meal distribution will continue at North Early Learning Center and West Orange-Stark High School. Distribution is Monday through Friday from 8:30 am to 12:30 pm.
District staff, your responsibilities moving forward, will be communicated from your supervisors.
Stay safe and Go Mustangs!
Sincerely,
Rickie Harris, Ed.D.

img.alt: closed remainder of school year

h3.a: WOCCISD Remains Closed for Remainder of 2019/2020 School Year

div.div:
Dear Mustangs, We are providing you with an update on school closures related to the COVID19 Coronavirus. Our schools will remain closed through the end of the school year per a directive from Texas Governor Greg Abbott. Rest assured that during the school closures, we will continue providing services, including online learning opportunities and meals to our families. Thank you all for your patience and understanding during this difficult time. The Flexible Education Program and Grab-and-Go meals will continue until June 3. We are still maintaining our original graduation date as is, but that is subject to change based on further direction from the Texas Education Agency. For more resources, visit WOCCISD-at-Home pages on our website as well as help desk emails for each campus. www.WOCCISD.net.
Free “Grab and Go” meal distribution will continue at North Early Learning Center and West Orange-Stark High School. Distribution is Monday through Friday from 8:30 am to 12:30 pm.
District staff, your responsibilities moving forward, will be communicated from your supervisors. Stay safe and Go Mustangs! Sincerely, Rickie Harris, Ed.D.

img.alt: Seniors 2020

div.div:
WOS Class of 2020:
WOSHS will have curbside cap and gown pick up Wednesday, May 6th, 2020, from 1-2 pm. For those who wish to order a cap and gown, visit balfourtexas.com.
If you cannot make it at the assigned time, please contact the HS and make alternate arrangements. WOS will host virtual graduation on June 5th unless otherwise allowed to host a traditional ceremony.
Seniors, please check for more communications from the high school in your google classroom for Seniors to submit information for graduation ceremonies and image requests.

ATTENTION MUSTANGS: As personnel begins to return to campus, we would like to stress that buildings and facilities are NOT OPEN. If you need access to something on campus, please contact your school by phone or email to make an appointment with campus personnel and continue to use proper social distancing protocol. Thank you.

img.alt: virtual job fair

div.div:
Are you or someone you know looking for employment? We are hiring certified and non-certified positions! We are doing virtual interviews! Apply online today. Visit the link below to view all the current openings! Share, share, share and let's get everyone back to work! https://www.applitrack.com/woccisd/onlineapp/
Virtual job fair, April 27th link to register https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfQ2HrN42OpVlizIcz3i2lDdrySGCuDETffddQQbxJ9bIJGWA/viewform?vc=0&c=0&w=1

img.alt: March 31 Statement

h3.a: WOCCISD Remains Closed; Anticipated Return May 5

div.div: Dear Mustangs, Enlight of the press conference today by Governor Abbott mandating school closures through May 1, WOCCISD will be again extending our Flexible Education Program. We now anticipate our start date to be May 5. Thank you for your continued patience as we work together as a community to keep everyone safe. I appreciate your efforts at home in helping provide our students with continuity of education during this closure period. Please contact your teacher by email if you need support in educating your children, after all, that is why we are here. WOCCISD will continue to send timely communications as information becomes available. We will continue to deliver Grab and Go breakfast and lunch between the hours of 8:30-12:30 at North Early Learning Center and West Orange-Stark High School. Stay safe and Go Mustangs! Sincerely, Rickie Harris, Ed.D.

img.alt: COVID-19 Response Survey

div.div: During these uncertain times, we want to make sure we are providing everything our parents and students need to continue to be successful. Please fill out the survey below to help us to improve and assess our resources.

video.alt: A message from Superintendent, Dr. Rickie Harris in response to COVID-19 Closure

div.div: West Orange - Cove CISD has a Texas Education Agency School Accountability score of 78 or a "C" rating. For more information, visit our Performance Reports page: http://www.woccisd.net/apps/pages/Performance
